items1: Be familiar with dependency managers like npm or yarn.
en.p1: To begin with, possibly the easiest way to start a project in BeyondJS is through the `@beyond-js/create-project`.
en.p2: Listed below are the flags that can be selected when installing @beyond-js/create-project:

items2.s1: -name: This allows you to define the scope and naming of the project. Projects follow the NPM standard. Read read more about it
-type: This allows you to define the type of project to create (this is optional), if not, a web-type project will be set by default. Accepted values ​​are:

p1.s1: You can read more about project types

items2: -container: This allows you to specify if you want to add a project container folder. Remember that BeyondJS supports the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
